required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: An Observational Study of Cisatracurium 0.15 mg/kg in Young and Elderly (≥ 80 Years) Patients.
clinical_study.official_title: An Observational Study of Cisatracurium 0.15 mg/kg, Comparing Onset Time, Duration of Action and Effect on Intubating Conditions in Young (18 - 40 Years) and Elderly (≥ 80 Years) Patients.

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to determine the onset time, duration of action and effect on intubation conditions of cisatracurium 0.15 mg/kg in elderly patients with age ≥ 80 years and in young patients aged 18 - 40 years.

detailed_description.textblock: The aim of this study is to determine the onset time, duration of action and effect on intubation conditions of cisatracurium 0.15 mg/kg in elderly patients with age ≥ 80 years and in young patients aged 18 - 40 years. The hypothesis of this study is that cisatracurium administered in elderly patients (>80 years) has a longer onset time and duration of action compared to younger patients.

primary_outcome.description: the time from the start of the injection of cisatracurium to train-of-four (TOF) count of 0 monitored by acceleromyography

secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 120 minutes after administration of cisatracurium
secondary_outcome.description: Duration of action is defined as time from start of cisatracurium injection to reappearance of TOF ratio > 0.9.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 10 minutes after administration of cistracurium
secondary_outcome.description: intubation conditions are rated according to intubating difficulty score IDS when TOF-ratio is 0.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 10 minutes after administration of cisatracurium
secondary_outcome.description: intubation conditions are rated according to Fuchs-Buder score when TOF-ratio is 0.

After 24 hours patients are asked about hoarseness and sore throat. Patients who experience either or both will be called 3 days postoperatively again. These two variables are assessed using a numeric ranking scale from 0 to 10.

secondary_outcome.measure: Amount of ephedrine or metaoxedrine administered
secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 10 minutes after administration of cisatracurium
secondary_outcome.description: If ephedrine or metaoxedrine is administered after induction of anaesthesia and until the patient is ready for properly positioning for surgery, it will be noted in the CRF, as well as the amount administered. Changes in blood pressure or heart rate are treated according to local guidelines.

intervention.description: 0.15 mg/kg based on ideal body weight calculated as height (cm) minus 105 for women and height (cm) minus 100 for men or actual body weight, whichever is lower

study_pop.textblock: Elderly patients (≥ 80 years) and younger patients (18-40 years) scheduled for elective surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Patients ≥ 80 or ≥18 - ≤40 years of age
2. Informed consent
3. Scheduled for elective surgery under general anaesthesia (expected duration of anaesthesia > 1 hour) with intubation and use of cisatracurium
4. American Society of Anaesthesiologists (ASA) physical status classification I to III
5. Can read and understand Danish
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Known allergy to cisatracurium
2. Neuromuscular disease
3. Indication for rapid sequence induction
4. Surgery in the prone position
